references.paper_title: StarCraft II: A new challenge for reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces StarCraft II as a challenging benchmark for reinforcement learning, influencing the design of AI agents for complex strategic games like One Night Ultimate Werewolf.

references.paper_title: Human-level play in the game of diplomacy by combining language models with strategic reasoning
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the successful integration of language models and strategic reasoning for complex games, providing a relevant example of LLM application in strategic interaction, which is directly relevant to the core of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Perfect bayesian equilibrium and sequential equilibrium
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Perfect Bayesian Equilibrium (PBE), a crucial solution concept for analyzing games with incomplete information which forms the theoretical foundation of the analyses performed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Conservative Q-learning for offline reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Conservative Q-Learning (CQL), an offline reinforcement learning algorithm used in the current paper for training the discussion policy.

references.paper_title: Emergent abilities of large language models
references.reason: This paper explores the emergent capabilities of large language models, which are leveraged in the current paper to construct intelligent agents for playing the One Night Ultimate Werewolf game.
